description: A radioactive isotope of carbon (carbon-14) with a half-life of about 5730 years, widely used in the dating of organic materials. Radiocarbon refers to radioactive carbon especially carbon-14, but also carbon-10 and carbon-12. Carbon-14 is a heavy radioactive isotope of Carbon having a mass of 14 and a half-life of 5730 +/-40 years. Carbon-14 is useful in dating organic materials during the last 50,000 years.
title: Radiocarbon
